title: Print, "A plate from the set of twelve projects for engraved silver cups (12 Stick Zvm Ver Zaichnen Stechen ver Fertigt Bernhartzan Goldschmid Gesel Inn Niernberg)", 1580
medium: Punch engraving, pen and black ink, graphite on off-white laid paper
markings: Watermark: bear with collar and hanging tongue (horizontal)
inscribed:
At center above image in margin, in pen and black ink: 88
At center below image in margin, in graphite: 12
dimensions:
Sheet: 29.5 x 18.6 cm (11 5/8 x 7 5/16 in.)
Platemark: 26 x 17.8 cm (10 1/4 x 7 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: A scrollwork frieze surrounds a fantastic animal mask ornamented with feathered headgear. Below a cluster of fruits and scrollwork, a seed flower hangs flanked by two additional masks.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "A plate from the set of twelve projects for engraved silver cups (12 Stick Zvm Ver Zaichnen Stechen ver Fertigt Bernhartzan Goldschmid Gesel Inn Niernberg)", 1580.
1580. Punch engraving, pen and black ink, graphite on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1942-36-19.
